intro: Alonsoa parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered alonsoa, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It produces small, tubular flowers that are usually pale yellow or greenish in color. Alonsoa parviflora is often found in regions with a Mediterranean climate, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
